page.title: 09Farming,Farms,Scremerston.
page.content: { Inland Pastures Farm}is about four hundred acres on which there are 80 acres of grassland,160 acres of wheat 130 acres of barley and 30 acres of peas.The grassland is used as permanent grazing for {14 cattle}and about{200 cattle}are wintered in sheds. The grass is also cut as silage, two cuts each year and hay is only made if the silage pit cannot hold all the grass. The farm has only{three staff}who live near the farm in cottages. The wheat is usually sown in September or October the same as the barley but the Spring Barley this year was sown in March and should be harvested in August. The small acreage of peas will be harvested as soon as they are ripe and sent to Scotland for freezing.
